subject: Climate & Environment
title: Glaciers as Water Towers
description: Learn Glaciers as Water Towers in one minute.

hook.text: Glaciers feed rivers that supply drinking water to 1.9 billion people worldwide.

buildup.text: In dry seasons, glacier melt keeps rivers flowing when rain stops.

discovery.text: The Himalayas alone supply water to 10 major river systems across Asia.

twist.text: Glaciers worldwide have lost over 9 trillion tons of ice since the 1960s.

climax.text: As glaciers shrink, rivers will surge with meltwater first â€” then dry up for good.

punchline.text: Glaciers are savings accounts. We are spending the last of them.

quiz.question: How many people depend on glacier-fed rivers for water?
